text:
Because I didnt know what to do coming out of college. My subjects meant I could go into engineering, computing or something maths related like accounting. 
So going to uni not knowing what you wanted to become wouldn’t have been smart. 
I started off with a IT apprenticeship , completed the 18month course then decided it wasn’t for me. Worked in a factory for 2 years (much longer then I wanted to) to try to make sense of where I was going. Then managed to get this.

The reason I personally feel a apprenticeship is better is because you get put straight into it. It’s all good learning theories etc but actually putting it in the real world is a whole lot different. Besides, accounting is always in high depend and companies are always looking for new blood, so it’s easy to get a apprenticeship.
Only thing Uni is good for us you get to concentrate purely on studying. And so when you finish the degree, you’ll have quite a few exemptions which should make fully qualifying not to difficult.

I really want to do an apprenticeship because I really feel University is not right for me, I want to directly get into the world of work which will allow me to build up experience, gain knowledge of how to apply what Ive learnt in my studies practically and be able to work my way up. Though university does have its pros it will take longer for me to actually reach where I want to reach which is to complete the ACCA.
Is an apprenticeship hard to get into if you dont have enough experience for it or if your grades dont make it up to their requirements
Could you also share some tips or advise me on how i can secure an accounting apprenticeship?
